result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Conley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter J Conley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter J Conley was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early discharge at 18 mo with agent approval.

DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Associated with Charge #1

02:25 PM Defendant Peter J Conley in court with attorney Michael J. Short. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 


On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Repeater Enhancer on Ct 1   . 
On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count 2   . 
 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 1  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  2 years

CONDITIONS:
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose
-Early discharge at 18 months with agent approval

COURT COSTS:
Ct 1
-DNA surcharge waived
-All other CC due on probation



-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.


-Days credit for time already served:  77 days
-Days credit if revoked: 77 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights
